text: Press Up Entertainment is a cinema, hotel, pub, retail and restaurant operator based in Dublin, Ireland. Ownership is shared between Paddy McKillen, Jr., son of Paddy McKillen, and Matt Ryan Their properties include the Clarence Hotel, the Irish franchise for Wagamama and the Stella Theatre cinema chain. They also operate two formerly franchised Tower Records locations, which have outlasted the US-based parent chain by many years.https://fora.ie/tower- records-dublin-3900435-Mar2018/ Most of their new properties are located in new developments by Oakmount, a property developer with the same owners but operated independentlyhttps://www.irishtimes.com/business/commercial- property/paddy-mckillen-jnr-s-press-up-selling-stake-for-up-to-50m-1.3987473 They have announced an entry in to operating bowling alleys, with a development at Dundrum Town Centre https://www.irishtimes.com/business/retail- and-services/press-up-to-bring-a-bowling-alley-to-dundrum-town- centre-1.3808266 The company investigated an initial public offering in 2018https://www.irishtimes.com/business/retail-and-services/paddy-mckillen- jnr-s-press-up-hires-city-broker-as-ipo-adviser-1.3559174, but this was cancelled in 2019 https://www.independent.ie/business/commercial- property/press-up-entertainment-set-to-keep-going-and-growing-but-ipo-on- hold-37789879.html ==References== ==External links== *Official site Category:Hospitality companies of Ireland Category:Tourism in the Republic of Ireland Category:Pubs in Dublin (city)
title: Press Up Entertainment
